Job Posting: 177975 - Position: S26 Business Intelligence (BI) Intern 177975 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/09/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/03/2026 09:13 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country iA Financial Group (Industrial Alliance) 988 West Broadway Vancouver V5Z 1K7 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Business Intelligence (BI) Intern 177975 Co-op Position Quebec, QC or Montreal, QC Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List • Employer: iA Financial Group • Office: 1080, Grande Allee West • Location: Québec, Quebec • Other Possible Location(s): Montreal, Quebec • Job category: Internships and Student Employment • Job ID: JR10025393 • Job type: Internship • Apply before: 2026-02-10 Description Summer Internship 2026 / Organizational Performance / Location: Quebec City or Montreal - Hybrid / Power BI Build the future with us Are you driven by data analysis, business intelligence, and continuous improvement and eager to contribute to the purpose of a company that aims to help its clients feel confident and secure about their future? As a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern, you will play a key role in implementing the integrated Lean performance strategy by leveraging process optimization, problem?solving, and business intelligence to support decision?making and continuous improvement. This position is a great opportunity to showcase your skills and fully realize your potential within a caring and trustworthy company. Here, people and their development are at the heart of our priorities, fostering an environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. What you will accomplish with us As a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern, you will be at the core of our mission. Your main responsibilities will include: • Deploying strategic dashboards by integrating best practices in data visualization to support strategic decision?making. • Developing and implementing key performance indicators (KPIs) to monitor operational effectiveness using tools such as Power BI. • Preparing clear and concise performance reports for presentation to the executive committee, ensuring continuous and transparent communication. • Collaborating on the implementation and management of a control tower (strategic obeya) to centralize performance monitoring and facilitate cross?departmental coordination. • Supporting the organizational performance team in aligning performance objectives with corporate strategies. • Tracking and evaluating the impact of performance initiatives using leading and lagging indicators to measure outcomes and efforts. • Leveraging business intelligence to transform data into actionable insights, enabling informed and proactive decision?making. Why you will love working with us • A work environment where learning and development merge with a collective pursuit of excellence. • A healthy, safe, fair, and inclusive environment where potential can be freely expressed and developed. • The possibility to work in a hybrid environment supported by flexibility and access to inspiring, innovative workspaces. • Student benefits: Access to internal training, mentoring, involvement in real projects, flexible schedules adapted to studies, and a rewarding experience for your professional journey. Job Requirements What will help you succeed in this role We are looking for someone who: • Is currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in Business Administration (IT, IS), Computer Engineering, or a related field. • Is recognized for strong proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Power BI, including knowledge of data governance, security, and performance principles, as well as solid ETL skills. • Has an intermediate level of English, as the role requires regular verbal and written communication with English?only internal partners. • Stands out for strong analytical and data?interpretation skills. • Demonstrates autonomy, curiosity, initiative, and the ability to work proactively. Is known for excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions APPLICATION LINK: https://ia.ca/en/carrieres/job/JR10025393 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
